A rolled-up towel or blanket: Rolling up a towel or blanket can provide a makeshift pillow that can be easily moved and adjusted for comfort.
A cushioned chair: If available, one could use a cushioned chair to sit in and lean back to rest their head on the back of the chair.
A folded shirt or sweater: Folding a shirt or sweater and using it as a makeshift pillow can provide some support and comfort.
A rolled-up piece of clothing: Rolling up a piece of clothing, such as a shirt or sweater, and placing it under the head can provide some cushioning.
A wooden or plastic crate: A sturdy crate can be used as a makeshift headrest, with a cushion or towel placed on top for added comfort.
